column4: anyone know how I might "duplicate" my wireless device?  I'm trying to be able to mess with my tapN devices as through iwconfig.  Any ideas/pointers?
you mean create two interfaces? like eth0 and eth0:0
sure, I think.  I thought tapN ws the way, but that would work to.  (What is that syntax?)
then you need to go to /etc/network/interfaces and create that interface
hmm, do you have any pointer to some documentation on that?
take a look of this: http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/reference/ch-gateway.en.html search for eth0:0
remember to use your own interface names, for wireless i would presume its wlan0
the example i gave you used eth0 and eth0:0 to create interface configuration. You said you need it for wireless, right? So you need to replace eth0 with your own interface, just a reminder for you
blast.  so this may be an issue of the driver and physical hardware, but I was hoping to have my wireless card be able to talk to two different wireless networks at the same time.
nope, that is impossible. A wifi card can be associated with only one station as far as i know
:-( But I can assign arbitrary mac addresses to devices
yes, you can change mac addresses for these virtual interfaces
yeah, but the underlying issue is still that the card would need to speak two different frequencies at the same time, right?
yup, and that is impossible as far as i know
:-)  I take that as a challenge!
